attributes.comment:
USCIS- 2006-0044
I have read the comments and see that of the 99 posted, 83 are against, 15 are for
and 1 makes no decision.

This country was built on the backs of immigrants, every American born citizen,
with the exception of the Native American Indian, was born here because an
ancestor was at one time an immigrant and that is a fact. This country was glad
to have the immigrants when it needed them to build, for railroads etc.

I understand that the government has decided that the process of filing to become
a legal citizen has to be paid for. But if the filing fees are increased beyond the
reach of the majority of immigrants wishing to apply, then the vast majority will
remain here illegally, until, or if, they are caught and deported.

There are illegal immigrants in this country using what appear to be legitimate
documentation they have bought for anything from $500 - $1500, these are one off
payments.

In Europe you do not have to pay to file and register to work, unless you employ
an attorney, or have an unusual circumstance.

Instead of not allowing them to work, they should be encouraged to find work and
maybe an attachment could be applied to their wages to repay the cost of the
process.

As for benefits they could be excluded from claiming them until such time as they
had paid in enough contributions to the system. This is something I personally
think should apply to everyone not just immigrants.

Also they should be obliged to sign to say that if they do not follow the laws of the
land and find themselves with a criminal conviction that this will lead to their
immediate deportation.

This is just another opinion.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Elizabeth Allen
